An airport is an aerodrome with extended facilities, mostly for commercial air transport. Airports often have facilities to store and maintain aircraft, and a control tower.
An airport is an aerodrome with facilities for flights to take off and land. Airports often have facilities to store and maintain aircraft, and a control tower.
An airport is a location where aircraft such as fixed-wing aircraft, helicopters, and blimps take off and land.
An airport is an aerodrome with extended facilities, mostly for commercial air transport.
Airports have luggage trolleys.
Airports are large areas of land or water that have been designated for use by aircraft for landing and takeoff.

A cruise ship or cruise liner is a passenger ship used for pleasure voyages, when the voyage itself, the ship's amenities, and sometimes the different destinations along the way (i.e., ports of call), are part of the experience.

Airport, train station, cruise ship, etc.
A train station is a place where trains stop.
Cruise ships are large passenger ships used mainly for vacations.
A cruise ship is a passenger ship used for pleasure voyages, where the voyage itself and the ship's amenities are a part of the experience, as well as the different destinations along the way.
A train station, railway station, railroad station, or depot is a railway facility or area where trains regularly stop to load or unload passengers or freight.

A cruise ship or cruise liner is a passenger ship used for pleasure voyages, when the voyage itself, the ship's amenities, and sometimes the different destinations along the way (i.e., ports of call), are part of the experience. Transportation is not the only purpose of cruising, particularly on cruises that return passengers to their originating port (known as "closed-loop cruises"). On "cruises to nowhere" or "nowhere voyages", cruise ships make two-to-three night round trips without any ports of call. In contrast, dedicated transport-oriented ocean liners do "line voyages" and
This is a cruise ship.

Luggage is the bag in which you carry your clothes, books, and other things when you are travelling.
Luggage is a suitcase or bag with clothes and personal items.
Luggage is the bags, cases and containers which hold a traveller's articles.
